headline: French health authorities launch major study of pollutants' impact on population's health
subhead: The new study will be conducted on 3,150 people to look at the effects of being exposed to a wide range of toxic substances.

headline: Philosopher Emanuele Coccia and designer Alessandro Michele believe fashion deserves a place in the world of ideas. Here's why
subhead: Clothing has long been dismissed or overlooked by most thinkers. In 'The Life of Forms,' Coccia and Michele establish an interesting dialogue, demonstrating the transformative power of a discipline far more profound than it may seem.

headline: How Greenland tries to avoid the over-tourism trap
subhead: As the territory with a population of 56,500 prepares to welcome a record number of visitors this year, the Parliament has passed a law designed to encourage local businesses and limit the arrival of large cruise ships.

headline: In Rome, Maria Grazia Chiuri's final bow
subhead: It was in her hometown that Dior's artistic director, Maria Grazia Chiuri, chose to stage her farewell show on May 27. Though nothing was revealed that day about her departure, the designer decided to celebrate the art and culture of the Italian capital, where she has just brought a small theater back to life near the Forum.
